NATO's Steadfast Defender exercises mark return to Cold War schemes, Russia saysThe scale of NATO's Steadfast Defender 2024 exercises mark an "irrevocable return" of the alliance to Cold War schemes, Russia's Deputy Foreign Minister Alexander Grushko told the state RIA news agency in remarks published on Sunday. Sun, 21 Jan 2024 05:13:52 GMT JBSW4IHM45LU5EHITEVJIPDHLU https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/natos-steadfast-defender-exercises-mark-return-cold-war-schemes- Russia-says-2024-01-21/Reuters世界欧洲
Two Russian sailors held in Mozambique as financial hostages, Moscow saysTwo Russian sailors being held in the Mozambique port of Maputo are financial hostages in a dispute between the ship's owner and its local customer, Russia's foreign ministry told the state RIA news agency in remarks published on Sunday. Sun, 21 Jan 2024 04:02:41 GMT UKPQ2HZK4NJRLFKXYWWU57OAKI https://www.reuters.com/world/two- Russian-sailors-held-mozambique-financial-hostages-moscow-says-2024-01-21/Reuters世界
What are the contentious events behind India's new Ram temple?Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lead a ceremony on Monday to consecrate a grand new temple to the Hindu god-king Ram, delivering on a campaign promise his political party made more than three decades ago. Sun, 21 Jan 2024 02:38:48 GMT 2G3AAFUP4BPERDX7HSDWAHRJQM https://www.reuters.com/world/india/what-are-contentious-events-behind-indias-new-ram-temple-2024-01-21/Reuters世界印度
Religious spectacle to mark opening of Ram temple by India's ModiA grand temple to Hindu god Lord Ram opens on Monday on a site in India millions believe is his birthplace, in a religious spectacle led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi months before he seeks a rare third term in elections. Sun, 21 Jan 2024 02:33:38 GMT QN4W6UJMPRMHFEGG5JKTVO3LDM https://www.reuters.com/world/india/religious-spectacle-mark-opening-ram-temple-by-india-modi-2024-01-21/Saurabh Sharma, Rajesh Prabhuswamy世界印度
Philippines' Marcos draws ire for helicopter use for Coldplay concertPhilippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr drew flak on social media for his use of a presidential helicopter to attend a concert by British rock band Coldplay in a province north of the capital, Manila. 'Murderer!': Peru president faces fierce backlash in slain protesters' hometownPeruvian President Dina Boluarte faced fierce backlash on Saturday from residents during a visit to the southern Andean region of Ayacucho, where 10 people were reported killed during anti-government protests in December 2022. Australia sweats in heatwave lifting bushfire risk, amid El NinoLarge swaths of Australia sweltered on Sunday in a heatwave, the nation's weather forecaster said, raising bushfire risk in an already high-risk fire season amid an El Nino weather pattern. Residents of southern Mexican town set government palace on fire after police kill young manResidents of a Mexican town set fire to the municipal palace overnight on Friday in a violent protest after local police shot a young man in the neck, according to his relatives, after he did not stop his car at a checkpoint.
